Dialogue.NPCText:
A hollow-eyed woman stands just beyond the village’s frozen boundary. Her ragged shroud seems woven from shadows and frost. Runic scars snake up her arms and neck, pulsing with a sickly azure light.

She inclines her head as you approach, frost swirling at her feet.
"Ash drifts east on the midnight wind... Yet still the wolf howls, old wounds unhealed. Why does a warm-blood wander where ice bites deepest?"

Option.text: Who are you? Why can’t you enter Frostmere?
You speak like the storm. What are you?
I come to help. Is there trouble here?
Tell me something real. What did you love, before all this?
I only seek shelter. Nothing more.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil traces a cracked rune on her sash.
"I am frost after fire, echo after scream... Once I served the Shadow Queen—Minax—until her lies froze my heart. Irinya watches me with owl’s eyes, but her trust is a distant sun."

Her gaze lingers on the village.
"The council marks me cursed. My scars burn at the village edge—old pacts forbid me sanctuary. Yet I see what others will not."

Option.text: What do you see, Ysil?
You served Minax? Why betray her?
Your scars—did Kaelen try to heal you?
That’s enough for now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She laughs—a brittle, hollow sound.
"What am I? A shadow wearing old flesh. The Obelisk calls me 'rune-bound'; Minax calls me 'traitor.' Frostmere calls me 'Hollow.' Yet names are as fleeting as snow in sunlight."

Her eyes glint behind the mask.
"Are you here to bear burdens, or cast more shadows?"

Option.text: Maybe both. Can I do anything for you?
If you’re cursed, should I trust you?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil’s fingers curl around her runebound mempo.
"The cold moon gnaws at the world’s bones… but a more present fang stalks these snows. The Glacial Timberwolf. Its breath withers hope, its howl makes even Svala’s heart falter. Once, it was a simple beast. Now, twisted—tainted by the same darkness that burned my soul."

She leans closer, frost swirling from her cloak.
"The wolf’s corruption is my own reflected in ice. Slay it, and perhaps some fragment of my sin will shatter. Or perhaps… the ice will claim us both."

Option.text: I will hunt the Glacial Timberwolf for you.
Why does the beast trouble you personally?
What if I refuse?
Tell me more about the wolf’s corruption.
I need time to prepare.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She bows, frost swirling up.
"The wolf prowls the pine-shadowed eastern ridge, where moonlight makes the snow bleed blue. It fears fire, but hungers for those marked by the Obelisk. Bring me a tuft of its glacial fur—or a fang frozen in regret. And beware—its howl can chill the marrow of your hope."

"Return, and I may share what I know of the final shard... or the shadow in Kaelen’s fate."

Option.text: I’ll bring proof of the kill.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil draws a spiral in the frost.
"The wolf was once my guide in the wild years—a silent watcher. When Minax’s magic swept north, I failed to shield it. Now it is a specter, bound to my own guilt. Its suffering is my shadow. Destroy it, and you free a piece of me—and Frostmere—from Minax’s old curse."

Option.text: I’ll accept your burden and hunt the beast.
I’m not sure I trust your story.
I’ll think about it.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She looks away, voice nearly lost.
"Minax’s corruption is not only of flesh, but of memory and soul. The wolf howls not for hunger, but for what it has lost—just as I do. The runes on my skin? They are a map of every oath I broke in her name. The wolf’s fur… will show you runes, if you look with frostbitten eyes."

Option.text: You carry a heavy burden.
If that’s true, I’ll hunt it in your stead.
Too much darkness for me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil’s eyes shimmer with tears, quickly frozen.
"You understand, more than most. Yet the north teaches: even the sharpest ice dulls with time, and wounds heal, if not forgotten. If you would help me, help Frostmere—hunt the wolf. Or at least… remember my story, when the snows fall silent."

Option.text: I will do this.
Not now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She bows her head.
"Then let the snows pile high, and let the wolf howl. There is always a price, even for refusal. If you return, the offer lingers, like frost on a forgotten grave."

Option.text: I’ll reconsider.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil’s scars pulse faintly.
"Kaelen has a healer’s heart, but his path twists as mine once did. He tried, with fire and frost, but wounds of the soul cannot be sealed by magic alone. If you see him, tell him the Hollow still dreams—of redemption, and of forgiveness."

Option.text: I’ll tell him if I see him.
You both deserve a second chance.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She stiffens, voice distant.
"I followed Minax in youth, drawn by the promise of power and belonging. But her shadow devours all light. I turned away too late; my soul bears the frostbite of regret. Now, I seek to undo what little harm I can. But the past is a river of ice—crossed, but never forgotten."

Option.text: We all have regrets. I will help if I can.
I’m not sure redemption is possible.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She shrugs, cloaked in silence.
"Trust is a fire seldom lit in these snows. Irinya listens, Bryndra sharpens her sword, Kaelen brings herbs—yet none see all my truths. If you would walk with wolves and exiles, you must risk frostbite."

Option.text: I will take the risk. Give me the quest.
Not today.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She gestures to the ever-falling snow.
"There is shelter in silence, and in the howl of the wind. If you seek warmth, the White Boar Inn may grant it. If you seek answers, you will find only riddles beyond this line of frost."

Option.text: Perhaps I will return.
I am ready to help now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil pauses, frost gathering on her lashes.
"Love? A word like dried flowers beneath glass—fragile and scented with memory. But... you ask with sincerity. Perhaps it is time I shared more than frost and riddles."

Option.text: Did you have a family?
Did you always serve Minax?
Did you have a hobby? Something peaceful?
What brought you north to Frostmere?

Dialogue.NPCText: "A sister, once. Mira. Laughed like thunder on still water. She joined the Circle of White Flame in Moonglow… while I fell into Minax's shadow. I have not heard her name in years. If she lives still, I dare not seek her. My shame is a blizzard too thick to cross."

Option.text: She might forgive you. Have you tried?
Minax breaks more than cities. I'm sorry.
You abandoned her. It was your choice.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil blinks back tears that freeze before falling.
"Hope is a dangerous kindness… but perhaps not without value. If I ever hear her name whispered by the wind, I will listen."

Option.text: Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She bows slightly.
"Pity from a blade is warmer than scorn. Thank you."

Option.text: Let’s talk about something else.

Dialogue.NPCText:
A harsh wind seems to rise with her words.
"Do not mistake brokenness for weakness. The first mistake I made was trusting the judgment of others over my own. The second... was surviving."

Option.text: Let's move on.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil runs her fingers along a deep rune scar.
"Minax found me when I was seventeen—bitter, brilliant, and burning for purpose. She offered power in exchange for silence. I gave her both. At first, I thought I was changing the world. Then… I watched it rot from the inside."

Option.text: Did you kill for her?
She lied to you. You were used.
And now you beg sympathy?

Dialogue.NPCText:
A long silence. Then:
"Yes. But I remember every face, every whisper before the end. The Hollow is not my name—it is what was left."

Option.text: Thank you for telling me.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She tilts her head, wistful.
"I carved sigils into ice—symbols of balance. In Wind, they said such work was frivolous. But when the wind sings and the light bends just so... the runes hum like silver bells. I still carve, sometimes. The ice remembers me."

Option.text: Could you teach me one of those sigils?
That sounds beautiful.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil traces a rune in the air.
"This one is called *Teyr-an-Hem*—it means 'Shadow yields to memory.' If you draw it at dawn into frost, it may ward nightmares... or awaken old ones."

Option.text: I’ll try it, next I find untouched snow.
Option.action: SendMessage:You feel a subtle insight stir within you.

Dialogue.NPCText: "After I escaped Minax, the frost welcomed me. I wandered until I found Irinya—we spoke without words. She saw the truth in my eyes, and led me here. The others do not trust me, but they don’t drive me away either. That is enough."

Option.text: You and Irinya are close?
Seems the others don’t understand you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Ysil lowers her voice.
"She dreams true. She saw my fall in frost and flame long before it happened. But her eyes are older than time—they see too far, and trust too little. Still... she is the first soul who named me 'Ysil' and not 'Hollow'."

Option.text: I’ll remember that.
